title: Usedom Botanical Gardens, Mellenthin
text:
The Usedom Botanical Gardens, Mellenthin () (60,000 m²) is a private <a href="botanical%20garden">botanical garden</a> located at Chausseeberg 1, <a href="Mellenthin">Mellenthin</a>, <a href="Usedom">Usedom</a>, <a href="Mecklenburg-Vorpommern">Mecklenburg-Vorpommern</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>. It is open daily in the warmer months; an admission fee is charged.
The garden was constructed between 2006-2008 and opened on May 1, 2009. It contains about 50,000 plants representing approximately 1,000 <a href="taxon">taxa</a> that are winter-hardy on the <a href="Baltic%20Sea">Baltic Sea</a> island of <a href="Usedom">Usedom</a>. Plants are arranged by botanical classification in 14 garden areas, with labels in <a href="Latin%20language">Latin</a>, <a href="German%20language">German</a>, and <a href="Polish%20language">Polish</a>:
